data.title: Stiftung Bundeskanzler-Adenauer-Haus
data.meta_description: Die Rhöndorfer Gespräche sind ein Forum des Austauschs über aktuelle Forschungsthemen rund um Konrad Adenauer und seine Zeit.
data.text:
The Rhöndorf Talks ("Rhöndorfer Gespräche") are a forum for exchange and dialogue on Konrad Adenauer and his time. Their beginnings go back to the late 1060s. At that time Adenauer’s estate was catalogued and continuously analysed. At the same time, many of the political associates in the Bonn environment were still present and willing to provide information.

This gave rise to the idea of a joint conversational format for historians and contemporary witnesses. The Rhöndorf Talks took place annually in the Foundation’s exhibition building; the focus was always on a topic relating to Adenauer’s foreign or domestic policy, which was analysed in academic presentations and then discussed. From 1978 onwards, the texts of the conferences were published in report volumes that combined filed-based contemporary history research and oral history.

In the meantime, the character of the series has changed fundamentally. The Adenauer era is no longer the immediate past, but has become historical. Its distant impact on our present is now becoming more apparent, resulting in new perspectives, new questions and new problems. With this in mind, the Rhöndorf Talks now offer academics an opportunity to discuss current research topics that relate to the Adenauer period, but also point beyond it. The results of the conferences are published in collected volumes.

Published so far:
